name: ComplianceGuard
description: Validates compliancy for permission settings in your Azure DevOps project
helpMarkDown: Validates compliancy for permission settings in your Azure DevOps project
author: DEVOPS IMPLEMENT

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command to run. Default command is validate.

inputs.name: settingsFile
inputs.label: Configuration settings file
inputs.helpMarkDown: File path for the configuration file to be used for validation

inputs.name: templateFile
inputs.label: Report template file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Template file using LIQUID syntax for formatted output report.

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory path for output files and reports

inputs.name: orgName
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Organization
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of Azure DevOps organization. By default value of variable $(System.CollectionUri)

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Name or Id of Azure DevOps project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name or Id of Azure DevOps project. By default value of variable $(System.TeamProjectId)

inputs.name: accessToken
inputs.label: Personal Access Token (PAT)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Personal Access Token (PAT) or JWT token for Azure DevOps. By default value of variable $(System.AccessToken)

inputs.name: installArguments
inputs.label: Tool install arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the additional arguments to be passed to **tool install** command.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run. Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory). The project search pattern is **NOT** relative to working directory.

messages.CouldNotSetCodePaging: Could not set the code paging of due to following error: %s
messages.Error_DuringValidationCommand: Validation command failed due to following error: %s
